body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Position the fuel tank to the frame.
Fit the fixing and its tube to secure the rear of the fuel tank to the frame and tighten to
Pivot the fuel tank upwards at the front. While holding the fuel tank in the raised position, locate the fuel tank support into the support points on the airbox and fuel tank.
Reconnect the fuel feed hose by gently pushing inwards until the hose engages with a click.
Slide the double check latch down (i.e. towards the spigot) until the release buttons are covered.
If the latch will not slide into position, then the fuel hose is not fully located on its spigot and must therefore be refitted correctly.
Reconnect the fuel pump electrical connection.
Reconnect the fuel level sender electrical connection.
Reconnect the two breather hoses as noted during removal.
Lower and secure the fuel tank (see
Securely fit the fuel tank support to its location under the seat base.
Battery Reconnection and fuel tank panel
Reconnect the battery positive (red) lead first and tighten to

search: Fuel Tank - Installation
Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Position the fuel tank to the frame.
Fit the fixing and its tube to secure the rear of the fuel tank to the frame and tighten to
9 Nm
Pivot the fuel tank upwards at the front. While holding the fuel tank in the raised position, locate the fuel tank support into the support points on the airbox and fuel tank.
Fuel tank support
Fuel tank
Supporting point, fuel tank
Supporting point, airbox
Reconnect the fuel feed hose by gently pushing inwards until the hose engages with a click.
Slide the double check latch down (i.e. towards the spigot) until the release buttons are covered.
If the latch will not slide into position, then the fuel hose is not fully located on its spigot and must therefore be refitted correctly.
Reconnect the fuel pump electrical connection.
Reconnect the fuel level sender electrical connection.
Reconnect the two breather hoses as noted during removal.
Lower and secure the fuel tank (see
Fuel Tank – Lowering and Securing
Securely fit the fuel tank support to its location under the seat base.
Reconnect the battery positive (red) lead first and tighten to
4.5 Nm
Refit the front panel to the fuel tank and tighten the fixings to
2 Nm
Refit the seats (see

and
